field.label: Enable
field.help: Periodically sync SSL certificate changes into the running HAProxy service. This is most useful when using short-lived Let's Encrypt certificates, but changes to other certificates will also be synced. Note that when using the Let's Encrypt plugin, it is also possible to use an Automation instead of this cron job.

field.label: Update OCSP data for SSL certificates
Enable
field.help: Periodically fetch OCSP data for all configured SSL certificates. Note that OCSP support needs to be enabled in HAProxy service settings.

field.label: Enable
field.help: Periodically perform a reload of the HAProxy service. This may cause a minor service disruption, depending on the configuration. A nightly reload could be used to apply configuration changes outside of business hours, or to workaround a bug.

field.label: Enable
field.help: Periodically perform a full restart of the HAProxy service. This will cause a notable service disruption. A full restart is required in some cases where a reload does not work as expected (i.e. due to long-running connections and very high timeout values).
